overview: This article critically explores how the global commercial space sector is evolving through surges of optimism, technological advancement, and recurring economic challenges. While private launches and innovation are reshaping access to orbit, sustained economic growth depends on bridging the gap between speculative vision and operational viability. Core recommendations include more patient funding, policy support, and a transparent industry culture to drive the shift from hype to enduring impact.
